text: Making Traditional Charoset Stir together all of the ingredients in a large bowl.  Cover the bowl. Keep at room temperature until it is ready to be served. Making Sephardi Charoset Puree the dates to make them smooth. Add the bananas, raisins, wine, and date syrup to the smooth date mixture. Process to mix everything. Add the walnuts, pistachios, almonds, and all the spices. Process until smooth. Place the mixture in a serving bowl. Cover and keep at room temperature until serving. Making Sephardi-Style Almond Charoset Simmer the dates with red wine in a small pot, mashing from time to time with a spoon, until smooth and thick. Let the mixture cool. Chop the nuts in a food processor. Fold nuts into the cooled date mixture. Chill before serving. Making Pomegranate Charoset Mix together the fruit and nuts.  Add the wine and the vinegar. Mix together to achieve the consistency of a paste. Add the spices and mix through. Taste and make any necessary adjustments. Cover the bowl and keep at room temperature until served.  Finished.
